rationale: The source schema has 'donor_id' (HuBMAP Display ID of the donor), but no corresponding field exists in the target schema.

'tissue_id' in the source schema represents the ID of the assayed tissue, while 'parent_sample_id' in the target schema refers to the HuBMAP/SenNet ID of the sample used for the assay. While the contexts are similar, the field descriptions indicate potential differences in application scope, making this a close match.
The source schema has a 'execution_datetime' field, which records the start date and time of the assay, but no corresponding field was found in the target schema.
Both fields represent the DOI of a protocol from protocols.io. The description and usage align closely, indicating an exact match.
The source schema includes 'operator' (the person responsible for the assay), but no similar field is present in the target schema.
The source schema has 'operator_email' (email address for the operator), but there is no corresponding field in the target schema.
The source schema includes 'pi' (Principal Investigator), but there is no corresponding field in the target schema.
The source schema includes 'pi_email' (email of the Principal Investigator), but there is no corresponding field in the target schema.

The source schema uses 'assay_category' to categorize the assay, while the target schema has 'dataset_type'. Although both represent types, 'dataset_type' is more focused on dataset output, making this a close match rather than exact.

'assay_type' in the source schema refers to the specific type of assay, while 'dataset_type' in the target schema refers to the specific type of dataset being produced. This is a close match, though not entirely exact.
Both fields represent the class of analyte being measured. They have identical names and descriptions, making this an exact match.
Both fields represent whether or not a specific molecule is targeted by the assay, making this an exact match.
Both fields represent the vendor of the acquisition instrument, making this an exact match.
Both fields represent the model of the acquisition instrument, making this an exact match.
Both fields refer to the number of cells or nuclei input into the assay. The naming conventions differ slightly, but the concept is identical.
Both fields refer to the DOI of the protocol for cell isolation. However, the target field description mentions more general preparation protocols, leading to a close match rather than an exact one.
Both fields specify whether or not the sequencing reaction is a technical replicate, making this an exact match.
Both fields represent the adapter sequence used in library preparation, making this an exact match.
Both fields represent the average fragment size of the library, making this an exact match.
Both fields represent the concentration value of the pooled library, making this an exact match.
Both fields represent the unit of library concentration value, making this an exact match.
No equivalent field found in the target schema for 'library_construction_protocols_io_doi' in the source schema.
No corresponding field for 'library_creation_date' (the date the library was created) exists in the target schema.
Both fields represent the total amount of the library after final PCR amplification, making this an exact match.
Both fields represent the units for the final library yield, making this an exact match.
The source schema includes 'library_id' (a unique library identifier), but no similar field exists in the target schema.
Both fields represent whether the library was generated for single-end or paired-end sequencing, making this an exact match.
Both fields represent the number of PCR cycles used in library preparation, but the target schema specifies this is only for indexing. This leads to a close match.
Both fields represent the reagent kit used for library preparation, making this an exact match.
The source schema has 'sample_quality_metric', but no equivalent field is found in the target schema.
No corresponding field for 'sequencing_phix_percent' exists in the target schema.
Both fields represent the sequencing read format and cycles, making this an exact match.
No equivalent field found in the target schema for 'sequencing_read_percent_q30' in the source schema.
Both fields represent the reagent kit used for sequencing, making this an exact match.

The source schema includes 'transposition_kit_number' for the Tn5 kit, while the target schema refers to 'transposition_reagent_kit'. Both fields refer to similar concepts but have differences in description and usage, leading to a close match.
Both fields represent the method or kit used for transposition, making this an exact match.
No corresponding field for 'transposition_transposase_source' exists in the target schema.
Both fields represent the relative path to a file with contributor details, making this an exact match.
Both fields represent the relative path to the data directory, making this an exact match.
